question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
How many 3-digit numbers have a first digit which is triple the final digit?
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{3}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
There are only three possibilities for the first digit: \[
\begin{array}{|c|c|}\hline
\text{First digit} & \text{Last digit} \\ \hline
3 & 1 \\ \hline
6 & 2 \\ \hline
9 & 3 \\ \hline
\end{array}
\] The middle digit can be any of the $10$ digits. The answer is $3\times 10=\boxed{30}.$
